company.name: Click Labs, Inc.
company.business_description: Click Labs, Inc. provides website and mobile app development and support services through the website www.jungleworks.com.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Click Labs, Inc., operating the website jungleworks.com, publicly claimed in its privacy policy that it had self-certified to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks, allowing it to lawfully transfer personal data from the EU and Switzerland to the United States. In reality, Respondent never completed the steps necessary to obtain certification from the U.S. Department of Commerce for either framework. Although the company initiated an application, it failed to finalize the process, yet continued to display these false certification claims on its website. These misrepresentations constitute deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to adhere to the Privacy Shield Principles through its organization's self-certification submission and that Jungleworks had certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles under both the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. frameworks
representations_made.quoted_text: 7.5 We agree to adhere to the Privacy Shield Principles, which were identified in our organization’s self-certification submission under “Other Covered Entities”. 7.6 We shall comply with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information transferred from the European Union and Switzerland to the United States. Jungleworks has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles.

counts.title: Privacy Shield Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represented, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it was a participant in the EU-U.S. and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
counts.fact: Respondent was never certified to participate in either the EU-U.S. or the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks; although it initiated an application, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Click Labs, Inc., a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, or participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership in, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any government- or self-regulatory-sponsored privacy or security program, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, and the APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to principals, officers, managers, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, Respondent must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For twenty (20) years after the issuance date, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to the Order, agents and representatives participating in related conduct, and any business entity resulting from a structural change; delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date for current personnel, and before assuming responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any Page 2 of 5 change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days for current personnel; before assuming responsibilities for others

requirements.description: From each individual or entity to which a copy of this Order was delivered, Respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt within thirty (30) days
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit sworn notices within 14 days of any change in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filing.

requirements.description: Within sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report identifying primary contact information, all businesses and their activities, compliance status for each provision, and copies of all Order acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance notice within fourteen (14) days of any change in a designated point of contact or in Respondent's corporate structure (including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any relevant entity)
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Respondent must submit notice of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: Any submission required to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, including a declaration statement with date, full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions to the Commission must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC, with the subject line beginning: In re Click Labs, Inc., FTC File No. 192 3090, Docket No. C-4705
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by Page 3 of 5 overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Click Labs, Inc., FTC File No. 192 3090, Docket No. C-4705.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for twenty years after the Order's issuance date, retaining each record for at least five years.

requirements.description: Respondent must create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold, for twenty (20) years after issuance, retaining each record for five (5) years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;
requirements.deadline: 20 years to create; 5 years to retain each record

requirements.description: Respondent must create and retain personnel records showing each service provider's name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination (if applicable)
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;
requirements.deadline: 20 years to create; 5 years to retain each record

requirements.description: Respondent must create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and
requirements.deadline: 20 years to create; 5 years to retain each record

requirements.description: Respondent must create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making that representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.
requirements.deadline: 20 years to create; 5 years to retain each record

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, inspecting records, conducting interviews, and using undercover means without prior notice.

requirements.description: Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, Respondent must submit additional sworn compliance reports or other requested information, and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.
requirements.deadline: 10 days of receipt of written request

requirements.description: Respondent must permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with it and to interview any affiliated individual who has agreed to be interviewed; interviewees may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all lawful means — including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals — without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process under FTC Act Sections 9 and 20
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory Page 4 of 5 process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on January 23, 2040, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: The Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later; the filing of such a complaint does not affect provisions terminating in less than twenty years, application to non-defendant respondents, or the Order if filed after termination
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

requirements.description: If a filed complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules Respondent did not violate the Order, and that result is not appealed or is upheld on appeal, the Order terminates as if the complaint had never been filed, except it will not terminate between the filing date and the later of the appeal deadline or the date the dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
